channel.title: #135: How to improve a B2B website’s content, with Hannah Adcock of Contented Strategy
channel.description:
Content specialist Hannah Adcock (@smokingpun) audited [Saber Feedback's website](https://saberfeedback.com/). In this episode, she tells us what's good about our site and what needs to change.
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/154ed302-ec5b-4b7f-a582-693eb54ae451?dark=false"></iframe>
Hannah runs [Contented Strategy](https://contentedstrategy.com/). She was [on the podcast a few months ago](https://discuss.bootstrapped.fm/t/bootstrapped-108-hannah-adcock-owner-of-contented-strategy/6563), when she talked about the benefit of a content audit.
In this episode Hannah is way more specific. She tears down the Saber Feedback website, section by section. And then she presents a plan for improvement.
Thanks to EmailToolTester who sponsored this episode. Find which email newsletter service actually reaches your customers with [EmailToolTester’s deliverability report](https://emailtooltester.com/deliver).
You can also [listen to and download this episode here](https://bootstrapped.fm/2020/05/22/135-how-to-improve-saber-feedbacks-website-content-with-hannah-adcock-of-contented-strategy/).

item.dc:creator: SteveMcLeod
item.description:
Steve said that the home page was now easily changeable. How are you hosting this and making this possible?

GitHub repo, using Markdown and Jekyll, hosted on Netlify.

A change to master gets detected by Netlify. Netlify builds the site and deploys it.

And about the blog: I understand that some of Matts post will be removed. I think many bootstrappers (me included) liked reading Matt’s posts.

Matt has a copy of all the posts, to use as he sees fit. I believe he will be putting some of them up on his new blog.

And there is always the wayback machine or internet archive!
